DOCNAME: CASE OF GHEORGHE AND MARIA MIHAELA DUMITRESCU  v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , who are father and daughter , were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant was grievously injured in a car accident . She suffered total paralysis of her lower limbs and was admitted to hospital where , according to the first applicant , she remained for DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unknown date during pre - trial investigations the second applicant ’s mother claimed damages in criminal proceedings . On DATE ORG attached to ORG of First Instance ( “ ORG ” ) committed PERSON , the driver of the car , for trial before ORG .

CARDINAL . Of the CARDINAL hearings held DATE and CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned for the absence of witnesses or of expert reports , for hearing new witnesses and for ordering a new expert report , CARDINAL at PERSON ’s request for the absence of her lawyer and CARDINAL for deliberations .

On DATE ORG convicted PERSON of having negligently caused bodily harm , sentenced her to a conditional prison sentence of DATE , held her personally liable and awarded both pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages to the second applicant and to her mother . It also ordered PERSON to pay the mother a DATE sum pending her daughter ’s recovery .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Regional Court ” ) rejected an appeal by the mother , considering that ORG had correctly reduced the damages on the ground of contributory negligence by the second applicant and lack of surveillance by the parents .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) upheld a subsequent appeal lodged by both the second applicant ’s mother and PERSON and quashed the previous judgment , sending the case back for retrial . The court noted that the insurance company had not been summoned .
CARDINAL . During the retrial the QUANTITY hearings held DATE and DATE were adjourned at the request of either PERSON or the insurance company .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sentenced PERSON to a conditional prison sentence of DATE , held her jointly liable with the insurance company and awarded both pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages to the second applicant and to her mother , including a DATE sum pending the second applicant ’s recovery .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected an appeal by the second applicant ’s mother and , finding that her daughter had been exclusively at fault , allowed an appeal by the opposing parties , held PERSON personally liable and reduced the amount of damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld subsequent appeals lodged by the second applicant ’s mother and by the public prosecutor , quashed the previous judgment and sent the case back for retrial . The court considered that both parties to the accident had been at fault and that ORG had not pronounced on all the complaints raised by the second applicant ’s mother .

CARDINAL . After the retrial , on DATE ORG allowed the action lodged by the second applicant ’s mother in part and awarded both pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages , finding PERSON jointly liable up to a certain sum and exclusively liable for the remainder .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a final decision rejecting as unfounded an appeal by the second applicant ’s mother . The court considered that the quantum of damages had been correctly assessed .
